intro: Silene paradoxa var. tenuicaulis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
